text:
It would be a great enhancement if JMeter would be able to use NTLM-
Authentication also. This would make it possible to test Intranet-Applications 
that use single-sign-on via IE/IIS and NTLM.
creator: christian.schulz@vattenfall.de

text:
It looks as though Commons HTTPClient handles NTLM authentication: see 
http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/httpclient/authentication.html
but there's no specific support in the new sampler yet.
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
Yes, commons HTTPClient supports NTLM-Authentication and - for me - it's works 
fine. It would be great if this part of Commons HTTPClient would be included in 
JMeter to make JMeter also support this kind of authentication.
creator: christian.schulz@vattenfall.de

text:
Would you care to post details (a patch maybe?) as to how to add NTLM support?

The file that would need to be changed is HTTPSampler2.java, which can be 
accessed in CVS at:
http://cvs.apache.org/viewcvs/jakarta-
jmeter/src/protocol/http/org/apache/jmeter/protocol/http/sampler/
creator: sebb@apache.org
